TopicTitle: Ask the Mods questions about the Forums!

Articles.Content:
Yes, thread of the month. 

And as long as you guys are asking moderator questions, I will merge this into the moderator question asking thread.
Do you mods see who reports posts or do you just see the report with the message attached?

> 
> 
> 26 minutes ago, DrLicor said:
> 
> 
> Do you mods see who reports posts or do you just see the report with the message attached?
> 

We also see who reports the post, which is important if we need to contact the person to ask for clarification if the issue is not clear.

Would it be possible to add some sort of "Save draft" feature to the forum?  

Something like this would be super handy for those of us that write really long story posts. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

I believe the forum automatically does that, [@Just Jim](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/148725-just-jim/). It's not perfect, but if you write a long reply and then get disconnected, it is usually there in the editing box when you hit reply next time.

Although a proper "save as draft" would be very interesting to see, that's true.

Yeah, it took 2 days to write up my last Emiko chapter, and I noticed what I had finished stayed put overnight. That was very cool, thanks! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

And I understand most people probably wouldn't need something like this, but it would be nice if we could actually save a draft, and know for sure it will be there the next day, if need be.

I would definitely not recommend relying on that feature. For long posts like you make for Emiko, it would be much safer to write it down in LibreOffice or something and then copy/paste it into the forum.

As far as I know, the forum software has no "save as draft" feature, and I couldn't see any plugins for that, but I'm sure [@ManeTI](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/167672-maneti/) will let us know otherwise.

...are my ears burning? Here's the config. It's quite simple.

    @PART[*]:HAS[@MODULE[ModuleProceduralFairing]]
    {@MODULE[ModuleProceduralFairing]{	@TextureURL = 00_Mine/fairings_smooth}
    }

Of course, you may need to change that path and will need a png, dds, or whatever image file to go with it. I used a fairing texture from procedural fairings, from what I recall. I won't distribute because I can't be bothered to look up their licensing ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")

(This was from about a year ago, so for all I know it won't work anymore, but it probably will)
